DataElement.preferredDefinition: The disease response in a non-target lesion using Immune-related Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (irRECIST) criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease Response Domain Non-Target Lesion Disease Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations._Other than the one for which something is done._A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Concepts.definition: A domain for disease response evaluations.

Property.preferredDefinition: Other than the one for which something is done.:A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.definition: Other than the one for which something is done.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDISC aligned NCI CRF standards task. mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A set of criteria for capturing the unidimensional measurements which are used to assess the effect of immunotherapeutic agents on solid tumors. These criteria are based on elements of the Immune-Related Response Criteria (irRC) and Immune-related RECIST (irRECIST)._Other than the one for which something is done._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A complete disappearance of  all measurable and non-measurable lesions. Lymph nodes must decrease to less than 10 mm in short axis. Confirmation of response is not mandatory.

Concepts.definition: A complete disappearance of all measurable and non-measurable lesions. Lymph nodes must decrease to < 10 mm in short axis. Confirmation of response is not mandatory.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A minimum 20% increase and minimum 5 mm absolute increase in total measured tumor burden compared to nadir, or irPD for non-target or new non-measurable lesions. Confirmation of progression is recommended minimum 4 weeks after the first irPD assessment.

Concepts.definition: A minimum 20% increase and minimum 5 mm absolute increase in total measured tumor burden compared to nadir, or irPD for non-target or new non-measurable lesions. Confirmation of progression is recommended minimum 4 weeks after the first irPD assessment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No target disease was identified at baseline and at follow-up the patient fails to meet criteria for irCR or irPD.

Concepts.definition: No target disease was identified at baseline and at follow-up the patient fails to meet criteria for irCR or irPD.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

Concepts.definition: A set of criteria for capturing the unidimensional measurements which are used to assess the effect of immunotherapeutic agents on solid tumors based on elements of Immune-related RECIST (irRECIST).
Other than the one for which something is done.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
